016
017package org.parboiled.support;
018
019/**
020 * A ValueStack is a stack implementation for parser values. The current state of the stack can be saved and restored
021 * with the methods {@link #takeSnapshot()} and {@link #restoreSnapshot(Object)} ()}, whose implementations should be
022 * super efficient since they are being used extensively during a parsing run. A ValueStack also serves as an Iterable
023 * over the current stack values (the values are being provided with the last value (on top of the stack) first).
024 *
025 * @param <V> the type of the value objects
026 */
027public interface ValueStack<V> extends Iterable<V> {
028
029    /**
030     * Determines whether the stack is empty.
031     *
032     * @return true if empty
033     */
034    boolean isEmpty();
035
036    /**
037     * Returns the number of elements currently on the stack.
038     *
039     * @return the number of elements
040     */
041    int size();
042
043    /**
044     * Clears all values.
045     */
046    void clear();
047
048    /**
049     * Returns an object representing the current state of the stack.
050     * This cost of running this operation is negligible and independent from the size of the stack.
051     *
052     * @return an object representing the current state of the stack
053     */
054    Object takeSnapshot();
055
056    /**
057     * Restores the stack state as previously returned by {@link #takeSnapshot()}.
058     * This cost of running this operation is negligible and independent from the size of the stack.
059     *
060     * @param snapshot a snapshot object previously returned by {@link #takeSnapshot()}
061     */
062    void restoreSnapshot(Object snapshot);
063
064    /**
065     * Pushes the given value onto the stack. Equivalent to push(0, value).
066     *
067     * @param value the value
068     */
069    void push(V value);
070
071    /**
072     * Inserts the given value a given number of elements below the current top of the stack.
073     *
074     * @param down  the number of elements to skip before inserting the value (0 being equivalent to push(value))
075     * @param value the value
076     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
077     */
078    void push(int down, V value);
079
080    /**
081     * Pushes all given elements onto the stack (in the order as given).
082     *
083     * @param firstValue the first value
084     * @param moreValues the other values
085     */
086    void pushAll(V firstValue, V... moreValues);
087
088    /**
089     * Pushes all given elements onto the stack (in the order as given).
090     *
091     * @param values the values
092     */
093    void pushAll(Iterable<V> values);
094
095    /**
096     * Removes the value at the top of the stack and returns it.
097     *
098     * @return the current top value
099     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
100     */
101    V pop();
102
103    /**
104     * Removes the value the given number of elements below the top of the stack.
105     *
106     * @param down the number of elements to skip before removing the value (0 being equivalent to pop())
107     * @return the value
108     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
109     */
110    V pop(int down);
111
112    /**
113     * Returns the value at the top of the stack without removing it.
114     *
115     * @return the current top value
116     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
117     */
118    V peek();
119
120    /**
121     * Returns the value the given number of elements below the top of the stack without removing it.
122     *
123     * @param down the number of elements to skip (0 being equivalent to peek())
124     * @return the value
125     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
126     */
127    V peek(int down);
128
129    /**
130     * Replaces the current top value with the given value. Equivalent to poke(0, value).
131     *
132     * @param value the value
133     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
134     */
135    void poke(V value);
136
137    /**
138     * Replaces the element the given number of elements below the current top of the stack.
139     *
140     * @param down  the number of elements to skip before replacing the value (0 being equivalent to poke(value))
141     * @param value the value to replace with
142     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
143     */
144    void poke(int down, V value);
145
146    /**
147     * Duplicates the top value. Equivalent to push(peek()).
148     *
149     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
150     */
151    void dup();
152
153    /**
154     * Swaps the top two stack values.
155     *
156     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
157     *          if the stack does not contain at least two elements
158     */
159    void swap();
160
161    /**
162     * Reverses the order of the top 3 stack values.
163     *
164     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
165     *          if the stack does not contain at least 3 elements
166     */
167    void swap3();
168
169    /**
170     * Reverses the order of the top 4 stack values.
171     *
172     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
173     *          if the stack does not contain at least 4 elements
174     */
175    void swap4();
176
177    /**
178     * Reverses the order of the top 5 stack values.
179     *
180     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
181     *          if the stack does not contain at least 5 elements
182     */
183    void swap5();
184
185    /**
186     * Reverses the order of the top 5 stack values.
187     *
188     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
189     *          if the stack does not contain at least 5 elements
190     */
191    void swap6();
192
193}
